result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark S. Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of payment of costs 11 days jail consecutive
Concurrent  with present sentence. Huber for work

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark S. Carlson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from defendant request to serve jail time for costs - Court ordered 12-17-15 in lieu of payment of costs 11 days jail consecutive.

Defendant Mark S. Carlson in court in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Scott Henry Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to count 1. Court finds defendant guilty of count 1. Court orders 8 months 19 days jail,  concurrent with present sentence. Huber for employment. In lieu of costs 11 days jail consecutive. Sentence credit of 65 days.
Defendant Mark S. Carlson in court in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calendar call scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mark S. Carlson in court in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $600 set. Defendant pleads not guilty jury trial to be set.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim, D.Z. his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
